translations.name: Esperanto Bible with Deuterocanon and Apocrypha
translations.description: One of the originators of Esperanto, L. L. Zamenhof, also translated the entire Hebrew Bible into the language he helped create. His translation has been much admired by Esperantists and is widely held up as a model for other Esperanto authors and translators. Other translators have also edited and published Esperanto versions of the New Testament and Apocrypha. By 2001 Berveling had also translated to Esperanto and published three volumes of the Deuterocanonical books (La duakanonaj libroj). Texts from the first two volumes, as used in the Orthodox, Roman Catholic and Lutheran churches, were incorporated into an edition of the Esperanto Bible published two years later.

translations.name: Malnova Kaj Nova Testamentoj Tradukitaj et la Originalaj Lingvoj

By 2001 Berveling had also translated to Esperanto and published three volumes of the Deuterocanonical books (La duakanonaj libroj).
